cache.CacheService.name: CacheService
cache.CacheService.doc: CacheService allows you to access a cache for short term storage of data. This class lets you get a specific cache instance. Public caches are for things that are not dependent on which user is accessing your script. Private caches are for things which are user-specific, like settings or recent activity.

method.name: getPrivateCache
method.doc: Gets the private cache instance for the script.

method.name: getPublicCache
method.doc: Gets the public cache instance for the script.

cache.Cache.name: Cache
cache.Cache.doc: A reference to a particular cache. This class allows you to insert, retrieve, and remove items from a cache. This can be particularly useful when you want frequent access to an expensive or slow resource. For example, say you have an RSS feed at example.com that takes 20 seconds to fetch, but you want to speed up access on an average request. function getRssFeed() { var cache = CacheService.getPublicCache(); var cached = cache.get("rss-feed-contents"); if (cached != null) { return cached; } var result = UrlFetchApp.fetch("http://example.com/my-slow-rss-feed.xml"); // takes 20 seconds var contents = result.getContentText(); cache.put("rss-feed-contents", contents, 1500); // cache for 25 minutes return contents; } You'll still need to wait the 20 seconds if the item is not in the cache, but subsequent calls will be very fast until the item expires out of the cache in 25 minutes.

method.name: get
method.doc: Gets the cached value for the given key, or null if none is found.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the key to look up in the cache

method.name: getAll
method.doc: Returns a JavaScript Object containing all key/value pairs found in the cache for an array of keys.

method.name: put
method.doc: Adds a key/value pair to the cache.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the key to store the value under

method.name: put
method.doc: Adds a key/value pair to the cache, with an expiration time (in seconds).

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the key to store the value under

argument.name: expirationInSeconds
argument.doc: the maximum time the value will remain in the cache, in seconds. The minimum is 1 second and the maximum is 21600 seconds (6 hours).

method.name: putAll
method.doc: Adds a set of key/value pairs to the cache.

argument.name: values
argument.doc: a JavaScript Object containing string keys and values

method.name: putAll
method.doc: Adds a set of key/value pairs to the cache, with an expiration time (in seconds).

argument.name: values
argument.doc: A JavaScript Object containing string keys and values

argument.name: expirationInSeconds
argument.doc: The maximum time the value will remain in the cache, in seconds The minimum allowed expiration is 1 second, and the maximum allowed expiration is 21600 seconds (6 hours). The default expiration is 600 seconds (10 minutes).

method.name: remove
method.doc: Removes an entry from the cache using the given key.

argument.name: key
argument.doc: the key to remove from the cache

method.name: removeAll
method.doc: Removes a set of entries from the cache.

argument.name: keys
argument.doc: the array of keys to remove
